newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures down in line with Japan.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures down in line with Japan.

text.p: Rubber futures slipped by midday on Friday in line with soft Japanese prices and a lack of fresh buying in the local market ahead of the weekend, dealers said.
"It's very quiet and followed the lead of the Japanese market this morning. There were no trades done and the ring sessions were zero again," a local rubber trader said.
Tokyo's benchmark March contract skidded 2.2 yen to reach 132.3 while Kobe's March contract shed 1.3 yen to reach 133.0 in the first afternoon session.
"The market was soft all around. There were some inquiries for RSS3 rubber, but that was it," another trader said.
At around 0445 GMT, November RSS3 was indicated at 122.00-123.00 U.S. cents a kg from 123.50 cents.
November RSS1 was indicated at 174.50-175.50 Singapore cents (US$1.23-$1.24) a kg from yesterday's settlement of 175.50 cents.
November TSR20 was indicated at 170.50-172.50 Singapore cents (US$1.21-$1.22) a kg against the previous 172.75 cents.
